condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF EAPR has strengthened capacity to design and implement gender responsive, equity focused NUTRITION programmes that deliver results for the most disadvantaged children at scale.

description.narrative: Intensified strategic and technical assistance and support for policy advocacy through its expanded nutrition team, with all countries visited including consultants in 2019. Joint ECD-Nutrition network & IMAM technical consultation. Total of 9 countries with updated IMAM protocols, 2 updated ones in 2019; 6 finalized landscape analyses on maternal nutrition & complementary feeding with prioritized national actions, 9 countries initiating evidence generation, strategies or some actions on overweight, an exponential increase from 0 in 2018. Bottleneck analysis on Code implementation completed for 4 countries; 3 more countries developed national protocols for nutrition in emergencies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of countries supported to implement initiatives for improved multi-sectoral implementation for complementary feeding and maternal nutrition and IYCF in general (new)
# countries supported to undertake evidence generation, policy advocacy, develop strategic frameworks for child overweight and initiate implementation (modified)
Number of COs that received technical assistance and training in analysis, planning and implementation of global and regional strategies for nutrition
Number countries supported to develop school and adolescent nutrition strategies and models of implementation
Number of Country Offices (COs) undertaking new CP design / MTR sucessfully supported on nutrition component (review Sitan, SN, SMR, CPD and Results Framework / structure etc.)

target.value: 2021:"5 CPDs: DPRK (potential request for 1 year extension), Lao PDR, Mongolia, Thailand (potential request for 1 year extension), Viet Nam; 2 MTRs TBC: Cambodia Philippines"

title.narrative: Number of countries supported to strengthen emergency preparedness planning, strengthen capacities, response, and analyze/plan for DRR/ Climate Resilience
Number of COs supported to strengthen nutrition data within national administrative monitoring systems and household surveys, with emphasis on data analysis and use
Number of countries supported to fully institutionalize IMAM in health systems, scale up services, and undertake bottleneck analysis
